intro.speaker: Morristan
intro.line: Send the new recruits along, then get to rounding up another half dozen or so.

intro.speaker: Elder
intro.line: W-wait, what are you doing?!

intro.speaker: Morristan
intro.line: Just what it looks like. A wyvern rider without a wyvern to sit on is just a bloke in a lizard hat.

intro.speaker: Elder
intro.line: Wyverns are the sacred protectors of this land, not glorified horses to be muzzled!

intro.speaker: Morristan
intro.line: I'd muzzle you, had I the time. As it stands, I'll take a quicker path to quiet. G'night!

intro.speaker: Elder
intro.line: Gwargh!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: N-no...! Run!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Your orders, sir?

intro.speaker: Morristan
intro.line: If word spreads, it'll only get more tedious. Sooo...yes. Better just kill everyone.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Where does this road lead?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: To Wyvern Valley, milord. Home to Valm's greatest feral wyvern population.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: That sounds...interesting. We'll have to be sure and keep our distance.

intro.speaker: Cherche
intro.line: Shame. My Minerva's fit to burst. She's excited others of her kind are near.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Oh? She doesn't look that excited to me. Not that I can really tell the difference...

intro.speaker: Cherche
intro.line: Oh, it's easy. She just looks even cuter than normal. Don't you, girl? Don't you look cuter? Who's a goooood wyvern?!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: I'll, uh...leave you to her, then.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Sir, over here! Please help! My friends will die if you don't!

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Wh-what?! But, sir, my friends!

intro.speaker: Gerome
intro.line: I'm not fit to fight for anyone.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: Th-then...they're lost...

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: You there! What's happened?

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: My people are fleeing for their lives from a pack of armed brigands, sir! And now we've gotten separated... Oh, the horror of it all!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Well, today's your lucky day. We'll aid you and your friends.

intro.speaker: Villager
intro.line: You will?! Oh, thank you! Please, sir! Give 'em what for!

recruit-talk.speaker: Cherche
recruit-talk.line: Wait. You're not one of the villagers.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cherche
recruit-talk.line: And a fellow wyvern rider, I see. This is a piece of good news! We fight to keep these villagers alive. Will you aid us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: Why? No man can stop fate.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cherche
recruit-talk.line: These people will be killed by spears, traveler. Not fate.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: Heh. Spoken like one who has yet to witness fate's implacable cruelty.

recruit-talk.speaker: Cherche
recruit-talk.line: So you do nothing, then, save wandering the land in the fog of cowardice? And your wyvern? Has she seen enough? Does she also yearn to surrender?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: ...... You would know better than I.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: Nothing. I'll fight if you wish it. Death will always have its due, but perhaps it will accept a few substitutions. Come, my dear Minerva. Join me on one final flight...

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Are you with the villagers? Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: These people are in desperate straits. Will you help us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: It is not for me to interfere in such matters. Death will always have its due.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: You would leave innocents to die and lay the blame on fate?

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: I've seen too much of fate's cruel work to doubt it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: So you would surrender rather than struggle against such cruelty... I cannot understand such thinking. A bleak past doesn't justify condemning the future to bleakness as well. Nonetheless, I cannot force your hand. Join us if you will.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerome
recruit-talk.line: What does he know of bleak futures? It is a fool who breaks himself against fate's tide. That said, I suppose I'm as big a fool as any... *sigh* Very well, then. Come, my dear Minerva. Join me on one final flight...

character-falls.speaker: Gerome
character-falls.line: Death...always has its...due... Go, Minerva... Be...free...

battle.speaker: Morristan
battle.line: Seems these newcomers have spine. Send word to the boys at the hold. Tell 'em we've got spines that need breaking.

boss.speaker: Morristan
boss.line: Wyvern or man, everyone's all snarl and fire until they learn the feel of the lash!

end.speaker: Villager
end.line: Our saviors! And it's more than lives you rescued... You've saved my hope in humanity, too. I thank you for it. Here, sir. A token of my gratitude

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Thanks to you as well, friend.

end.speaker: Villager
end.line: Take care, now. We'll pray for a safe journey for you and your troops.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: Do you have a moment?

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: I was hoping you might introduce me to your wyvern.

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: Why?

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: To see which of ours is cuter. Not very sporting of me when mine is the finest in the world, I know.

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: ...Do as you please.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: I will, then! Thank you. ...... ...Hee hee! Oh, but you ARE cute! She's nearly a match with Minerva! ...Nearly so in every way. Wait, what sorcery is this? They...they look IDENTICAL!

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: That's because they are identical. They're one and the same.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: ...M-Minerva? How is that possible?

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: You could examine her from tip to tail looking for scars and marks if you like. ...Or you could just look at this ring.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: I...I know that ring. So then you're...

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: I am, though I had not intended that we meet.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: Why not?

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: I came back in time so I might release Minerva. Not to seek out parents to whom I've already bidden farewell.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: You crossed the bounds of time just to set Minerva free? Whatever for?!

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: In the future I know, she is among the last of her kind. I...I could not leave her to that solitude.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: She is lucky indeed to know someone of such kindness. ...As, I imagine, am I.

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: Stay your words. I've no intention of getting close to you. Fate will not be mocked. This war may claim your life anew, and I'll not weep twice for losing the same mother. My burden is heavy enough.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: But yet you carry it still.

end.speaker: Gerome
end.line: That's enough.

end.speaker: Cherche
end.line: Thank you, Gerome.
